data.title: Biggest airlines in the world
data.meta_description: In this article, we will take a look at the top 10 biggest airlines in the world based on their fleet size.
data.text:
The airline industry has witnessed significant growth over the years, with the emergence of new airlines and the expansion of existing ones. Today, there are several airlines operating across the globe, each striving to offer the best services to its customers. In this article, we will take a look at the top 10 biggest airlines in the world based on their fleet size.

Largest airline in the world

American Airlines

With a fleet size of over 950 aircraft, American Airlines is currently the largest airline in the world. The airline operates both domestic and international flights and serves over 50 countries worldwide.

Delta Air Lines

Delta Air Lines operates a fleet of over 900 aircraft and is the second-largest airline in the world. The airline offers services to over 300 destinations across the globe.

United Airlines

United Airlines is the third-largest airline in the world with a fleet of over 800 aircraft. The airline operates both domestic and international flights and offers services to over 300 destinations.

Southwest Airlines

Southwest Airlines

Southwest Airlines is the largest low-cost carrier in the world with a fleet size of over 700 aircraft. The airline operates primarily in the United States and offers services to over 100 destinations.

China Southern Airlines

China Southern Airlines is the largest airline in China and the fifth-largest in the world with a fleet size of over 600 aircraft. The airline operates both domestic and international flights and serves over 40 countries.

Air France-KLM

Air France-KLM is a Franco-Dutch airline holding company with a fleet size of over 500 aircraft. The airline operates both domestic and international flights and serves over 100 countries.

Ryanair

Ryanair is the largest European low-cost carrier with a fleet size of over 450 aircraft. The airline operates primarily in Europe and offers services to over 40 countries.

Turkish Airlines

Turkish Airlines is the largest airline in Turkey and the eight-largest in the world with a fleet size of over 350 aircraft. The airline operates both domestic and international flights and serves over 120 countries.

Lufthansa

Lufthansa

Lufthansa is the largest airline in Germany and the ninth-largest in the world with a fleet size of over 300 aircraft. The airline operates flights to over 200 destinations across the globe.

Emirates

Emirates is the largest airline in the Middle East and the tenth-largest in the world with a fleet size of over 250 aircraft. The airline operates flights to over 150 destinations across the globe.

In conclusion, these are the top 10 biggest airlines in the world based on their fleet size. These airlines are known for their excellent services and have contributed significantly to the growth of the aviation industry.
